info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 06 at 10:19PM CDT until August 06 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR RICHLAND AND SOUTHERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 1018 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Noble, or 7 miles southwest of Olney, moving east at 40 mph. Other thunderstorms with heavy rain were located along a line from Xenia to Claremont. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Olney, Calhoun, Parkersburg and Claremont. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central and southeastern Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
